children.subject: If you are looking for a SWE job, you can start now. There are recruiters looking for people to start next fall that are recruiting now, especially for larger companies, e.g. Google has already started recruiting. I'm not sure about other positions.

history.content: If you haven't started recruiting yet, I strongly encourage you to start now. Big companies, especially the well known and/or prestigious ones, primarily recruit in the fall semester for people graduating in the following spring (which means you). You'll definitely have companies recruiting in the spring (mostly until mid-spring) too, but just not in the same magnitude as the fall. Also, if you're aiming for small startups, spring is an acceptable time to do recruiting, since small startups have more variable needs and thus have a shorter time period between interviewing you and having you start working.

If you haven't started recruiting yet, I strongly encourage you to start now. Big companies, especially the well known and/or prestigious ones, primarily recruit in the fall semester for people graduating in the following spring (which means you). You'll definitely have companies recruiting in the spring (mostly until mid-spring) too, but just not in the same magnitude, as the fall. Also, if you're aiming for small startups, spring is an acceptable time to do recruiting, since small startups have more variable needs and thus have a shorter time period between interviewing you and having you start working.

I keep seeing a lot of recruiters on campus and I had originally planned to start applying for jobs in December- April because I'm planning to graduate in May 2020, but I was wondering if I should start earlier, like now? I decided on that timeline because I was thinking that recruiters who were around now are looking for people to start early next year, which I can't do because of school, but is that even true?

And if so, does anyone have any suggestions/website links I could check out? Especially for recruiters who are looking for people to start after May?

Btw, I have been doing most job searches on LinkedIn, but if anyone else has another source I'd love to hear about it. Thanks!
history.subject: When to start applying for jobs
